entries.meaning: (telegraphy) Involving the transmission of two messages in the same direction at the same time.
examples: Diplex and contraplex are the two varieties of duplex.

verbs.description: diplex (third-person singular simple present diplexes, present participle diplexing, simple past and past participle diplexed)

entries.meaning: (radio) Simulcast the same signal on two frequencies.
(radio) Combine two signals using two frequencies onto one cable.
